Worker_003_0.speaker: Falael
Worker_003_0.text: One five six, one five seven, one five - oh! Um, sorry, can't chat! One five... shit, where was I up to?
Worker_003_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kneeling and inspecting animation, stands up on "um, sorry"

Worker_003_2.speaker: Player
Worker_003_2.text: You'd got up to one five eight.

Worker_003_1.speaker: Falael
Worker_003_1.text: Oh, thank Corellon. You're a life-saver. One five eight, one five nine...

Worker_003_9.speaker: Falael
Worker_003_9.text: Wait, are you - oh. I see. Real comedian type. Piss OFF.

Worker_003_8.speaker: Falael
Worker_003_8.text: I was counting broadsheets for distribution. Let's pray I've not lost count.

Worker_003_3.speaker: Falael
Worker_003_3.text: One sixty. Okay, let's mark that... Great. One six one, one six two...

Worker_003_6.speaker: Falael
Worker_003_6.text: One hundred and... Corellon help me. Okay. UGH. One. Two. Three. Four...

Guard_TrespassWarning_0.speaker: Guard Unilda Tiro
Guard_TrespassWarning_0.text: Oi, citizen - stop right there. Basement's off-limits 'cept to Mr Needle.

AD_EttvardMuttering_2.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_2.text: But it does have to be catchy...

AD_EttvardMuttering_1.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_1.text: Yes, there's no bloody point sending it to print if folk won't remember it!

AD_EttvardMuttering_12.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_12.text: So perhaps alliteration is the way...

AD_EttvardMuttering_3.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_3.text: We'll need more pieces to support it in the edition afterwards.

AD_EttvardMuttering_9.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_9.text: Boots-on-the-group interviews with victims of the miscreants. Yes, excellent.

AD_EttvardMuttering_5.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_5.text: 'Local Tavernkeep HATES Adventurers: Here's Why. Yes, Alan owes me a favour.

AD_EttvardMuttering_10.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_10.text: Profanity's cheap... Putting a name to these miscreants is hard...

AD_EttvardMuttering_0.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_0.text: 'Avaricious Adventurers', maybe? No no no - the alliteration stings.

AD_EttvardMuttering_7.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_7.text: We could just call them bastards. There's no law against that.

AD_EttvardMuttering_11.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_11.text: This is going to absolutely catapult sales.

AD_EttvardMuttering_6.speaker: Ettvard Needle
AD_EttvardMuttering_6.text: The people of this city love a hero and villain piece. We have our villain...

Reporter03_0.speaker: Glimmer Whistleborn
Reporter03_0.text: Can't write a bloody shopping list at the minute with all these eyes on me.

Reporter03_1.speaker: Glimmer Whistleborn
Reporter03_1.text: I'd hoped with Gortash dead the Steel Watch would have better things to do than cramp up our writer's room.

Reporter03_3.speaker: Glimmer Whistleborn
Reporter03_3.text: Dear reader: I was a fool.

Reporter03_2.speaker: Glimmer Whistleborn
Reporter03_2.text: How am I s'posed to write about Lord Gortash's life when I'm afeared for my own? Bloody Steel Watchers...

Reporter03_4.speaker: Glimmer Whistleborn
Reporter03_4.text: Don't know about you, but them big metal bastards really put me off my flow.

Gossiper001_0.speaker: Caitlin
Gossiper001_0.text: You want the who's who and the what's what? Speak to Carys. She's always got the best goss - none of it's been wrong yet.

Gossiper001_1.speaker: Caitlin
Gossiper001_1.text: It's honestly amazing, I'd have thought Carys' gossip would have been wrong at least once. But no - always bang on.

Gossiper001_2.speaker: Caitlin
Gossiper001_2.text: Oh my... I read all about you in the gazette. Very impressive...

Gossiper001_3.speaker: Caitlin
Gossiper001_3.text: Oh no, not you. I know all your nasty tricks - read about them in the broadsheet.

Reporter02_0.speaker: Ty Willowbrook
Reporter02_0.text: Father Lorgan's corpusculent... Err... corpse... Shit, no. Look, mate, can you stop staring at me? Really putting me off.

Reporter02_1.speaker: Ty Willowbrook
Reporter02_1.text: HANG ON! Wait, stay there. You've reminded me of that word I was looking for... cor... cor... corpusculent. That's it. As you were.

AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_3.speaker: News Hawker Luan
AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_3.text: Below the fold again Estra, I told you you should've added pictures!

AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_2.speaker: Estra Stir
AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_2.text: Go on then. Tell me a story that'd beat Gortash's death for the headline.

AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_1.speaker: Estra Stir
AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_1.text: Go on then, if you think you can do better - pitch me your story.

AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_0.speaker: News Hawker Luan
AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_0.text: All right here's one for you - did you hear about the rabbit that became a frog?

AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_4.speaker: Estra Stir
AD_EstraAndPaperBoy_4.text: Mmmhmm. Perhaps you just focus on the paper selling and leave the writing to me.

Worker_002_0.speaker: Jarlath
Worker_002_0.text: Used to be much quieter round here... Much less profitable, mind, so it ain't all bad.

Worker_002_1.speaker: Jarlath
Worker_002_1.text: No time to chat, mate, sorry. Since Gortash donated this printing machine, we've had ridiculous volume to shift.

Guard4_DefaultDialog_0.speaker: Guard Inocente Bramm
Guard4_DefaultDialog_0.text: Look mate, could you shove off? We're expecting a new ink shipment soon.

Guard4_DefaultDialog_1.speaker: Guard Inocente Bramm
Guard4_DefaultDialog_1.text: You know what? I'm glad they posted me out here. Those writers were starting to piss me off - all the incessant, inane chatter.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_7.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_7.text: Hah! Caught you! Bet you thought you were so clever sneaking back in... GUARDS!

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_17.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_17.text: Lord Gortash is going to destroy me. I swear, you'll rue the day you crossed Ettvard Needle.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_23.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_23.text: I know you meddled with my printing press. I know you published that fluff piece about yourself.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_95.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_95.text: And I also know it doesn't matter. Sure, some will read it - but you're no dead duke. You're old news. To be forgotten.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_42.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_42.text: How is one meant to cover a dead duke with an equally dead printing press...? Simply can't supply the demand...
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_42.context: NodeContext: muttering to self, clearly very stressed ignoring player

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_44.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_44.text: Well, well, if it isn't the city's next celebrity! You star in our next edition's top story.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_107.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_107.text: I did, until I swapped out the articles. You'll smear me no more.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_15.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_15.text: Seems odd you've written the article before asking me any questions.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_62.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_62.text: Estra deals with the personal interviews and fluff pieces. I deal with the truth. And the truth is - you're a damned menace.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_72.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_72.text: Yeah - I heard all about your article, and I want you to shut it down.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_80.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_80.text: Ettvard Needle. Editor of the Baldur's Mouth Gazette. Speaking truth to power since 1450 DR.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_65.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_65.text: No need to introduce yourself. I make sure I become intimately familiar with my subjects before writing about them.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_32.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_32.text: Are you sure you have enough ink to cover all my adventures?

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_40.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_40.text: We have plenty of ink. Enough to cover all your misadventures in this good city.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_96.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_96.text: Trafficking refugees into our city is hardly a good look. Especially when so many are Absolutists and murderers.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_11.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_11.text: Not many enter our fine city and immediately start meddling in murder investigations. Curious, don't you think?

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_39.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_39.text: I've never heard of so much violence against innocent circus freaks before.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_1.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_1.text: I heard you may be affiliated with the arsonists who destroyed our Steel Watch protectors.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_99.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_99.text: The truth will be out with tomorrow's broadsheet. People will spit in your face. Your very presence will be bad for business. You'll be a pariah. An outcast. As you should be.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_49.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_49.text: And then we can only hope the Fist do their duty and escort you to the gallows! Your days scumming up this good city's streets will be over.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_87.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_87.text: I'd be terrified if I hadn't changed the article already.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_24.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_24.text: Shall I add 'lying cretin' to your long list of misdeeds? You speak nonsense.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_38.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_38.text: I'm working with Lord Gortash. He wouldn't want bad rumours spread about me.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_27.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_27.text: Nice try - but it's not going to work. Lord Gortash and me are very close and he mentioned no such thing to me.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_29.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_29.text: This letter proving you're Gortash's puppet would make a better headline.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_56.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_56.text: Pray tell - how exactly will you disseminate that information? What's the name of your highly popular broadsheet? No? Exactly.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_86.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_86.text: I would never reveal my sources, and certainly not to the likes of you. Besides, you're too late.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_4.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_4.text: Perhaps a bit of coin could make the article go away?

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_20.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_20.text: You'd like me to add bribery to your list of extra-legal pursuits? How bold.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_92.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_92.text: If what you've just said is true, pissing me off is a bad idea. Stop the article.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_97.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_97.text: First I will break your printer. Then I will break YOU. STOP THE ARTICLE.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_22.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_22.text: It'll be your word against mine - and I'm really good with words.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_26.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_26.text: Stop the article, or I'll cook you from the inside out.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_3.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_3.text: I'm not afraid of you. Lord Gortash is a passionate champion of the journalistic arts - attack me, and you face the Steel Watch.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_98.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_98.text: The headlines are loaded into the printworks already. Tomorrow you will feel the power of free speech. Vox populi, vox dei.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_18.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_18.text: Print that about me and I'll push your corpse through the Gazette printworks.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_8.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_8.text: You know I've done far, far worse than that, right?

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_30.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_30.text: ...Oh, really? I'm all ears, my quill dipped, dunked, and ready to tell the world whatever you wish to confess.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_53.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_53.text: Imagine a chronicle of your deeds, written in bile on the skin of fools.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_100.speaker: Narrator
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_100.text: *Your tongue slithers over your glory like the snake it is, tasting each misdeed once again.*
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE GRINS - DARK URGE RAGE GRAPHIC PLAYS

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_105.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_105.text: Gods, the untold depravity... it is unprintable. I'll be out of syndication if I publish your gore-smut confessional.
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: When the dark urge leaves the frenzy of their imagination, Ettvard is shocked.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_69.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_69.text: We will stick to our existing story, and you're fortunate that's all.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_6.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_6.text: Now, GUARDS! I believe our distinguished guest was just leaving. Would you care to escort them out?

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_78.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_78.text: Let the guards take you outside.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_102.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_102.text: Bite your tongue. Grant them mercy from your horrible tale.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_93.speaker: Narrator
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_93.text: *With great difficulty, you throw aside the desire to toot your own terror-trumpet for this smut-peddler.*

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_83.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_83.text: Oh, I know plenty about you already, knave.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_76.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_76.text: Since your arrival, reports of Absolutist activity in this city have increased tenfold. Hardly seems a coincidence.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_47.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_47.text: How long is this article? Because I've got a lot of stories - and I only blow up in some of them.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_37.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_37.text: I have more than stories - ballads, prose, even a haiku or two, if you can spare the ink.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_57.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_57.text: How long is this article? I'd love to publish some of my own magical theories.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_63.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_63.text: I'd rather your paper focus on more pressing things - like this city, and how it squanders nature's gifts.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_82.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_82.text: How about a piece on siege tactics? Or self-defence? I have plenty of suggestions.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_85.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_85.text: I might have to check in with my patron about that first - see how they feel about being in the spotlight.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_106.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_106.text: I have no need of such attention. I suggest you focus on something useful - like the obvious corruption in this city.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_13.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_13.text: I'd rather you spread the word about the one I serve. I have some suggestions, if you'd like.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_0.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_0.text: My prowess in battle does the talking for me - I have no need of your 'stories'.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_41.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_41.text: Well, you should've considered that before disgracing yourself in public.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_14.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_14.text: I'd rather not be in your paper at all. Anonymity is helpful in my... business.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_89.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_89.text: I'd rather not be in your paper at all.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_94.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_94.text: Suit yourself - be sure to have a gander at tomorrow's edition - you star.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_81.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_81.text: The guards will see you out.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_59.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_59.text: You again. Old news - I've got a dead duke to commemorate. Be on your way.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_64.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_64.text: Say - I know that face. We had an absolute blinder of a piece ready to print about you. Would've been your ruin, I reckon.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_2.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_2.text: But alas. Any articles not about Gortash's death might as well be bog roll at the moment.
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_2.context: NodeContext: a bit more to himself, he's ignoring the player thinking about the articles he's comissioning

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_51.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_51.text: If anything bad is printed about me, I'll leak this letter to you from Lord Gortash.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_90.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_90.text: Why were you writing something negative about me?

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_35.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_35.text: Oh, you gave us plenty to work with.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_84.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_84.text: However, column space is a rare commodity when a lord dies. So you can consider the tales of your misdeeds indefinitely postponed.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_101.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_101.text: Now, take your leave. I have so many articles to arrange for the next edition - dead men might tell no tales, but they certainly sell them.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_45.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_45.text: If anything bad is printed about me, your obituary will follow soon after.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_79.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_79.text: You think I'd dedicate precious column space to a miscreant like you when a lord's just died? Do get a grip.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_21.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_21.text: A shame it was never published - I always wanted to be in a broadsheet.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_71.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_71.text: That's the spirit - better people spit your name than not say it at all.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_73.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_73.text: If you think bothering me will delay your article being published, you're quite deluded.

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_34.speaker: Player
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_34.text: Would these blackmail letters from Gortash delay publication?

Ettvard_DefaultDialog_88.speaker: Ettvard Needle
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_88.text: We can still publish, but Gortash'll have my hide if I don't fix the printworks - You! Get out of here, I'm busy!
Ettvard_DefaultDialog_88.context: NodeContext: muttering to self, then notices the player after hyphen

Guard2_DefaultDialog_0.speaker: Guard Vlomina
Guard2_DefaultDialog_0.text: 'Fraid I'll have to ask you to stop there. Only Ettvard's allowed to use the basement elevator.

Guard2_DefaultDialog_1.speaker: Guard Vlomina
Guard2_DefaultDialog_1.text: If you want to use the elevator, speak to Ettvard. I've been told no one's allowed down to the basement.

ElfsongWanderer_000_0.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_0.text: Look, you might be a big shot in the broadsheets now, but doesn't mean you can keep interrupting us normal folk.

ElfsongWanderer_000_1.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_1.text: Shame about Lord Gortash dying - the Mouth reckons he was a stand-up fellow.

ElfsongWanderer_000_2.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_2.text: Look, you must have something better to do than bother me. Anything.

ElfsongWanderer_000_3.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_3.text: Can't I pace and think in peace? The cheek of you.

ElfsongWanderer_000_4.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_4.text: Wonder if the Gazette will investigate Gortash's death... Folk deserve to know who did it.

ElfsongWanderer_000_5.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_5.text: Saw your picture in the gazette, I did. Matches the ugly deeds.

ElfsongWanderer_000_6.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_6.text: Keep pestering me and I'll fetch the guards. Surprised they've let you walk free, they must have read the Baldur's Mouth too.

ElfsongWanderer_000_7.speaker: Cressida Flint
ElfsongWanderer_000_7.text: Oh, you! From the Baldur's Mouth article! I must dash, but I enjoyed reading of your deeds. Keep it up.

AD_Reporter01Combat_0.speaker: Salene Freig
AD_Reporter01Combat_0.text: We are not paid enough for this!

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_1.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_1.text: Yes, I agree, Mr Needle, they are ugly.

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_4.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_4.text: Depraved, too, in my estimation! Maybe laying it on a bit thick.

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_2.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_2.text: See, Mr Needle, I first met the late Lord Gortash when I was a child...
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_2.context: NodeContext: conducting a mock interview with herself

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_3.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_3.text: Oh gods, what if they only report on heroics these days?

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_18.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_18.text: Slaying a necromancer seems a lot of work...

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_7.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_7.text: What do I think of the awful, terrible adventurers? Well, Mr Needle...

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_8.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_8.text: In my opinion, we should have a Steel Watcher in every Baldurian home!
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_8.context: NodeContext: conducting a mock interview with herself

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_20.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_20.text: Why? I'm glad you asked - it'd certainly help with the dishes! Hah!
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_20.context: NodeContext: conducting a mock interview with herself

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_5.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_5.text: Okay, after the joke, he'll laugh. Leave him some time, and then...

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_14.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_14.text: I do think it's our duty as citizens to reflect on Lord Gortash's life now he's passed...

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_10.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_10.text: Now, would he ask about the adventurers in the latest issue?

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_6.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_6.text: Don't be silly, of course he will. Well, Mr Needle...

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_11.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_11.text: Yes, they are indeed paragons of virtue. But there's another hero, too.

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_17.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_17.text: You, Mr Needle, for making their story known.

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_12.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_12.text: Lord Gortash's death? Well, Mr Needle, it's a real tragedy...
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_12.context: NodeContext: conducting a mock interview with herself

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_16.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_16.text: Why yes, Ettvard - can I call you Ettvard?

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_0.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_0.text: Well, Ettvard, I do support Lord Gortash's campaign, for several reasons...

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_19.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_19.text: What do I think of Lord Gortash's Steel Watch?
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_19.context: NodeContext: conducting a mock interview with herself

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_13.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_13.text: Well, I am so glad you asked, Ettvard! No, no, bit too familiar. Mr Needle...
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_13.context: NodeContext: conducting a mock interview with herself

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_21.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_21.text: No, Mr Needle, I, too, can't believe Absolutists would sneak into the city.

AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_15.speaker: Sadar Illanov
AD_Wanderer_04_Greeting_15.text: Especially Absolutists disguised as adventurers! Lowest of the low...

PaperBoy_Docks_0.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_0.text: I'm not giving out any more free copies. I'll be putting the bog-paper shop out of business.

PaperBoy_Docks_1.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_1.text: Oh look, today's star. Everyone else might think the sun shines out your hole, but I don't care. Gazette's [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54] gold, same as always.

PaperBoy_Docks_11.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_11.text: There you go, hero. Don't let the fame go to your head - if it gets any fatter, it'll explode.

PaperBoy_Docks_12.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_12.text: Get your copy of the Baldur's Mouth Gazette here. 'News that bites b-' Oh. You again. It's [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54] gold, same as before.
PaperBoy_Docks_12.context: NodeContext: said in a montone, humdrum way

PaperBoy_Docks_29.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_29.text: You want a copy of this rag? [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54] gold - make it quick.

PaperBoy_Docks_18.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_18.text: My stupid dad makes me sell these shite-rags. Pillock. If you want one, it's [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54] gold.

PaperBoy_Docks_26.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_26.text: Yeah - the best one in town. Also the only one in town. Want a copy? [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54] gold.

PaperBoy_Docks_38.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_38.text: Works great as toilet paper if you run out.

PaperBoy_Docks_36.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_36.text: 'The Baldur's Mouth Gazette. When the Mouth barks, the Fist bites...' Uh... I forget the real slogan, but you get the idea. Now, buy a copy or leave.

PaperBoy_Docks_7.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_7.text: So you're still standing here why?

PaperBoy_Docks_34.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_34.text: Ooh, bad luck. You're plastered all over today's gazette, and it ain't pleasant reading.

PaperBoy_Docks_27.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_27.text: Honestly, if you pissed them writers off, you're good in my books. Either way, it's gold for a copy, if you're curious. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperBoy_Docks_5.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_Docks_5.text: You know what'd really annoy the writers? Giving me a free copy.

PaperBoy_Docks_21.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_21.text: Paper says a lot of bad things about you - I'll add 'cheap bastard' to the list. Take one. What do I care?

PaperBoy_Docks_16.speaker: News Hawker Jonah
PaperBoy_Docks_16.text: Do I look like a library to you? Get your free reads somewhere else, cheap prick.

Worker_005_0.speaker: Delcan
Worker_005_0.text: Sorry, was I not clear enough last time? I DON'T SELL THE BROADSHEETS. Goodbye.

Worker_005_1.speaker: Delcan
Worker_005_1.text: I keep telling you animals. If you want to buy a gazette, talk to the loud little shits screaming headlines. I deliver the papers. I do NOT sell them.

Wanderer_07_1.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_1.text: The Blushing Mermaid is an adrift shipwreck in more ways than one. For starters -
Wanderer_07_1.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

Wanderer_07_0.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_0.text: Excuse me, I must return to my work. The Baldur's Mouth Tavern Review doesn't write itself.

Wanderer_07_3.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_3.text: Oh my word! It's you - from the front page! Could you spare a few words for my article?

Wanderer_07_7.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_7.text: No - that'd take too long. I'll just paraphrase. The hero of Baldur's Gate looked in disgust at the tavern...
Wanderer_07_7.context: NodeContext: correcting self, italics are you composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out loud

Wanderer_07_4.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_4.text: Incessantly interrupting street wanderers ruin the atmosphere outside the Blushing Mermaid...
Wanderer_07_4.context: NodeContext: he's composing an article in his head, this is pointedly turned againt the player in annoyance

Wanderer_07_6.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_6.text: Could you not have been more considerate in your misdemeanours?

Wanderer_07_5.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_5.text: Some of us have tavern reviews to publish, and your crimes have taken up all the column space.

Wanderer_07_8.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_8.text: The Blushing Mermaid is also frequented by the criminal scum haunting this very gazette's hallowed pages.
Wanderer_07_8.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

Wanderer_07_9.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_9.text: It is a shame Lord Gortash passed before his Steel Watch could condemn this wretched tavern, this absolute hive -
Wanderer_07_9.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

Wanderer_07_10.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_10.text: It seems, dear readers, that this spot is often frequented by a hero of Baldur's Gate...
Wanderer_07_10.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

Wanderer_07_11.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
Wanderer_07_11.text: This reporter found himself distracted by both Lord Gortash's tragic death and unbearably talkative street vagrants outside the Blushing Mermaid...
Wanderer_07_11.context: NodeContext: he's composing an article in his head, this is pointedly turned againt the player in annoyance

FrontDoorGuard_001_0.speaker: Guard Wulf
FrontDoorGuard_001_0.text: I bloody SAID you looked like trouble. Could smell it a mile off.

FrontDoorGuard_001_1.speaker: Guard Wulf
FrontDoorGuard_001_1.text: Don't bother the workers out here. They're already behind on deliveries without you lot pestering them.

FrontDoorGuard_001_2.speaker: Guard Wulf
FrontDoorGuard_001_2.text: You're barred, mate. Never had to bar someone from a gazette office before - first for everything, I guess.

FrontDoorGuard_001_3.speaker: Guard Wulf
FrontDoorGuard_001_3.text: Oi, I got my eye on you. You got the look of a troublemaker.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_1.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_1.text: It seems no commemorative events for Lord Gortash are planned at the Mermaid.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_7.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_7.text: This tavern is content to be a blight not only on the eyes, but also the soul.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_2.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_2.text: One would think, dear readers, that the death of Lord Gortash would inspire solemnity.
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_2.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_16.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_16.text: This is most untrue of the Blushing Mermaid. A raucous hive, as usual.
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_16.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_3.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_3.text: Not content with broadsheet front pages, criminals stalk outside the Mermaid.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_8.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_8.text: I'm sorry to report, faithful readers, that the Mermaid's staff do not care...

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_6.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_6.text: Look, what are heroic folks like you doing near a dump like the Mermaid?

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_20.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_20.text: Can hardly lambast the place if you're here. My readers will revolt.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_9.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_9.text: While taverns like the Elfsong sit in safe streets - this is not true of the Mermaid.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_0.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_0.text: Vagabonds and criminals frequent the Mermaid's exterior, dear readers.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_11.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_11.text: The Mermaid, faithful readers, has the tackiest architecture...
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_11.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_10.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_10.text: ...matched only in disappointment by its threadbare pint selection.
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_10.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_12.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_12.text: New, heroic clientele may be visiting the Blushing Mermaid, dear readers.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_13.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_13.text: Readers sad at recent news may think the Mermaid a tempting sorrow-drowning spot.
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_13.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_4.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_4.text: But there are better drinking spots to commemorate the late Lord Gortash.
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_4.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_14.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_14.text: While I would love to report the Mermaid as nothing but an absolute hive...

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_19.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_19.text: ...it appears local heroes frequent the tavern. Why? Only the gods can know.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_18.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_18.text: Tavern Review enthusiasts will note the absence of the landlord from this article.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_5.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_5.text: While I requested an interview, Captain Grisly certainly lives up to her name.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_21.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_21.text: The Blushing Mermaid. Not my preferred drinking hole, dear readers.
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_21.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_15.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_15.text: In fact, 'hole' may the perfect word to describe the tavern...
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_15.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_22.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_22.text: Expect unceasing harassment by scum outside the Blushing Mermaid.

AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_17.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
AD_Wanderer_07_Greeting_17.text: Would anyone feel safe in a place like this? Not I, dear readers. Not I.

PAD_KickedOut_0.speaker: Player
PAD_KickedOut_0.text: Dammit - if that story goes to print, we're in trouble.

Wanderer_06_0.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_0.text: Things aren't like they used to be - broadsheet says it all, really.

Wanderer_06_1.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_1.text: The paper quality's atrocious! Worn edges, easy tearing - that newfangled mechanical printworks is to blame.

Wanderer_06_2.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_2.text: I wonder which of Ettvard's rings you kissed to get such a glowing write-up in the Mouth.

Wanderer_06_3.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_3.text: Used to work for Baldur's Mouth, I did. Sacked me after they got that new printworks - arseholes.

Wanderer_06_4.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_4.text: Yeah, I know you. Despite the Mouth's shoddy inkwork, I knew it. You're that scoundrel from the latest edition.

Wanderer_06_5.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_5.text: The Mouth's muddy printing did you a favour, actually. You're much uglier in person.

Wanderer_06_6.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_6.text: Back in my day, the Mouth didn't print fluff pieces. You must've done something real special.

Wanderer_06_7.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_7.text: Hopefully the Mouth'll print a couple less fluff pieces about Gortash now he's shuffled off permanently.

Wanderer_06_8.speaker: Ciara Blank
Wanderer_06_8.text: Back in my day, there used to be proper reporting done at the Mouth - even when a lord died. None of corpse-boot-lick nonsense.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_9.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_9.text: But no. You've got to be a lord for the 'broadsheet of record' to care if you live or die.
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_9.context: NodeContext: broadsheet of record said derisively

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_3.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_3.text: Don't fancy my cause being associated with folk like you.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_5.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_5.text: Another broadsheet full of pointless obituary pieces.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_6.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_6.text: We get it, Lord Gortash is dead!
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_6.context: NodeContext: annoyed a paper repeating itself

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_7.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_7.text: How much longer can the Baldur's Mouth ignore this?

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_19.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_19.text: These gallows kill people. Our people!

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_10.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_10.text: People like you make what I do so much harder.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_2.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_2.text: Can hardly argue against execution when menaces like you run free, can I?

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_12.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_12.text: Only way to raise awareness is that bloody Baldur's Mouth Gazette, though.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_11.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_11.text: Editors there couldn't give a toss about hanging, though. Shame.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_13.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_13.text: Sure, it's sad when a lord dies. But folk are dying every day on these gallows!

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_14.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_14.text: Another broadsheet full of adventurers this, adventurers that.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_8.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_8.text: What use are adventurers if we still slaughter our own citizens?

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_15.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_15.text: Don't care what a gazette says - real heroes would destroy the gallows.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_18.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_18.text: Put a stop to this brutal, archaic nonsense.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_17.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_17.text: Normal citizens strung up to die by the city. A real people's broadsheet would care.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_20.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_20.text: Horrible, those gallows, aren't they? Shame no one cares enough.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_0.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_0.text: Folk don't even think about it much, I bet. But they should.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_21.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_21.text: Hang around these gallows too long and someone will string you up.

AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_16.speaker: Reagan Splint
AD_Wanderer_03_Greeting_16.text: And I'm not sure even I would stop them.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_0.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_0.text: I'm not paid enough to deal with threatenin' types, you can kindly shove off.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_1.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_1.text: Oi oi! If it ain't the stars of today's edition!

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_18.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_18.text: 'Fraid I can't give you the Gazette for free, but you can have it for a low, low price. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_8.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_8.text: Pleasure doin' beeswax with a proper heroical type!

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_23.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_23.text: I 'spose that makes sense. If I did all that heroical stuff, readin' about it would get all boring.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_9.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_9.text: COME GET YER COPY OF THE BALDUR'S MOUTH GAZETTE! WHEN THE MOUTH SPEAKS, THE CITY SHAKES!

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_17.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_17.text: All right there, chief! Can I interest you in a copy of our fine, fine broadsheet? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_25.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_25.text: Have a gander at that. Come back tomorrow if you fancy fresh news.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_6.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_6.text: Suit yourself. If you change your mind I'll be here all... well, all the time, really.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_10.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_10.text: 'Ello again, squire. Fancy a copy of today's edition?

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_22.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_22.text: Shittin' hell... It's you. Thought I recognised your ugly mug from the front page.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_15.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_15.text: Get it quick, then scarper - you're bad for business.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_5.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_5.text: If all that is true, you should be scared of pissing me off. Hand over the paper. NOW.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_13.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_13.text: All right, all right! I'm not paid enough to deal with harassment and the like. Take it.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_3.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_3.text: Now, uh, look guv, don't shoot the messenger, all right? I just hawk the broadsheet, I don't pen it.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_12.speaker: News Hawker Jason
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_12.text: Maybe you ain't seen inside the gazette's headquarters, but we've got the Steel Watch on our side. I'm not afeared of you.

PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_11.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_DefaultDialog_11.text: I'm not interested in that pack of lies.

Worker_004_0.speaker: Bronte
Worker_004_0.text: Newsflash, dipshit - you're interrupting me. Make like a page and turn.

Worker_004_1.speaker: Bronte
Worker_004_1.text: Listen, pal, if you're not moving my share of broadsheets, you're in my way. Shift!

AD_MalekCombat_0.speaker: Malek Stones
AD_MalekCombat_0.text: 'The pen is mightier than the -' no, that's horseshit, RUN!
AD_MalekCombat_0.context: NodeContext: terrifeid, combat has broken out

AD_Gossipers_7.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_7.text: Some real excitement in the Gazette this morning, Cait!

AD_Gossipers_3.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_3.text: Oh, what fantastic news - just as I was worried I'd have to find a new broadsheet.

AD_Gossipers_6.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_6.text: A group of heroical adventurers slew a necromancer! At least, according to the Mouth.

AD_Gossipers_19.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_19.text: I don't know, Carys. Could just be a tall tale - wouldn't be the first to cross the Gazette's pages.

AD_Gossipers_12.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_12.text: Oh, don't be a bore, Caitlin!

AD_Gossipers_21.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_21.text: Besides, it's better than another fluff piece about the Gate's nobility.

AD_Gossipers_9.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_9.text: Broadsheet's rather dull today. Don't suppose you've learnt anything... juicier, of late, Carys?

AD_Gossipers_13.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_13.text: Afraid not - both the gossip and the Gazette have been drier than the Anauroch recently.

AD_Gossipers_15.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_15.text: It's a shame, Ettvard used to do such a good job running the Gazette.

AD_Gossipers_16.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_16.text: But these days it's hard to tell if I'm reading the Baldur's Mouth or Gortash's diary!

AD_Gossipers_4.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_4.text: Oh, come now, Carys, the broadsheet isn't that bad.

AD_Gossipers_18.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_18.text: I don't know, Caitlin, I've read the Mouth for years - this is the closest to a rag it's ever been!

AD_Gossipers_14.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_14.text: Say, Carys, did you read the gazette this morning?

AD_Gossipers_11.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_11.text: Indeed I did. But, dear Caitlin, not everything made it to print.

AD_Gossipers_5.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_5.text: No. You're telling me the Baldur's Mouth kept information back?

AD_Gossipers_17.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_17.text: Oh yes - you'll never guess what I heard about the vagabonds.

AD_Gossipers_10.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_10.text: They call themselves 'adventurers' - they've not slain a single dragon.

AD_Gossipers_22.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_22.text: Found anything interesting in today's broadsheet, Carys?

AD_Gossipers_8.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_8.text: Hah! Not of late - unless you want more lordly boot-licking - straight from the Baldur's Mouth!
AD_Gossipers_8.context: NodeContext: italics said like a mocking slogan

AD_Gossipers_1.speaker: Caitlin
AD_Gossipers_1.text: What about Estra's column? She always has something juicy in the Gazette.

AD_Gossipers_20.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_20.text: Even Estra's column has been lacking sauce of late... It's a real shame.

AD_Gossipers_0.speaker: Carys
AD_Gossipers_0.text: It's not what it used to be, the Baldur's Mouth. Not at all.

ElfsongWanderer_001_0.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_0.text: Look, I read that if you walk around the pub after each pint, you don't get a hangover. And if it's in the gazette, it has to be true.

ElfsongWanderer_001_1.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_1.text: Where do I know you from... Oh! The gazette! Yeah, I read that you were good people.

ElfsongWanderer_001_2.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_2.text: Lord Gortash's death is sad and all, but I didn't know you could write so many obituaries about one bloke!

ElfsongWanderer_001_3.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_3.text: Listen, I gots to concentrate if I'm to walk off these pints.

ElfsongWanderer_001_4.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_4.text: Now, where do I know you from... Oh. You were in the gazette. I - I don't want any trouble mate.

ElfsongWanderer_001_5.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_5.text: You again... Hey, I don't want to end up in the Baldur's Mouth obituaries. You'll get no trouble from me.

ElfsongWanderer_001_6.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_6.text: Every headline at the moment's about the - *hic* - late Lord Gortash. Mayhaps I'll raise a cup in his memory.

ElfsongWanderer_001_7.speaker: Bunt Chugley
ElfsongWanderer_001_7.text: Surprised the Baldur's Mouth didn't mention how chatty you were - I thought you hero types were all high and mighty!

Guard4_TrespassWarning_0.speaker: Guard Inocente Bramm
Guard4_TrespassWarning_0.text: Downstairs is off limits, civvie. Take it up with Ettvard if it bothers you.

FindingTheDraftPaper_1.speaker: Narrator
FindingTheDraftPaper_1.text: *You examine what appears to be a test print of tomorrow's broadsheet. Numerous corrections are marked in red ink.*

FindingTheDraftPaper_2.speaker: Narrator
FindingTheDraftPaper_2.text: *You notice one of these corrections scrawled in the margins. Whoever's tampering with the printer, stop it. You're wasting my time.*

FindingTheDraftPaper_5.speaker: Narrator
FindingTheDraftPaper_5.text: *The content of  the broadsheet is troubling. You feature heavily in the central article, lambasted as a danger to the city.*

Cynics_001_0.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_0.text: Oh shit, you're the one in the new gazette edition. Look - I know I'm not supposed to believe everything I read.

Cynics_001_9.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_9.text: But if even a fraction of what they wrote about you in that article is true, I want nothing to do with you. Sorry.

Cynics_001_1.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_1.text: I'd hoped the Gortash fluff pieces would stop once he went belly up. Turns out they just got more annoying.

Cynics_001_2.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_2.text: Stay sceptical out there, pal. Not enough in this city do - 'specially with that gazette rag in circulation.

Cynics_001_3.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_3.text: If it isn't the gazette's favourite hero. As you were.

Cynics_001_4.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_4.text: Seen the headlines? Bloody Lord Gortash's only gone and bit the big one!

Cynics_001_5.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_5.text: The broadsheets are going to be insufferable about this, you mark my words.

Cynics_001_6.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_6.text: Keep your distance, pal. I don't want it on record that I've met you.

Cynics_001_7.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_7.text: Now - I don't believe everything I read. 'Specially from the gazette. But if you're even half the hero they said you were - bloody good stuff.

Cynics_001_8.speaker: Iza Blouin
Cynics_001_8.text: Got a tip for you, mate. Don't believe everything you read.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_1.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_1.text: I mean, can't believe everything you read, but...

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_4.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_4.text: If even half Ettvard's reporting is true... Some folk are just nasty.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_2.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_2.text: Maybe the Mouth doesn't get paid for coverage.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_15.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_15.text: If they were being paid, the pages wouldn't be so flimsy.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_5.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_5.text: Quality of journalism's pure toilet too these days.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_0.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_0.text: Can't believe they didn't even interview these folks they're trashing.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_7.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_7.text: All this broadsheet coverage for one dead lord - it's exhausting.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_8.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_8.text: An entire edition dedicated to one lord and his metal toys?

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_6.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_6.text: Gortash has got to be paying the Mouth's ink fees.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_9.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_9.text: An entire edition dedicated to one lord - dead or no - is a bit too much.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_18.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_18.text: Bet Gortash's estate is paying the Mouth's printing fees.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_10.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_10.text: First Lord Gortash, now these noble adventurers...

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_3.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_3.text: The Mouth barely prints any criticism these days.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_11.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_11.text: Maybe I should drop the gazette a few platinum.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_13.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_13.text: Not to mention the parchment quality of the gazette - awful.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_16.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_16.text: The broadsheet's gone to pot ever since I left.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_17.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_17.text: You can barely make out what the gazette's printed these days.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_12.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_12.text: But even through the ink blots, seems there's some rotten characters around.

AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_19.speaker: Ciara Blank
AD_Wanderer_06_Greeting_19.text: I thought the gazette got bad after I left - it's been downright terrible since Gortash died.

AD_PaperBoys_7.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_7.text: Breaking news! The Mouth said it first!

AD_PaperBoys_11.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_11.text: Dangerous adventurers infiltrate the city and threaten civilians' safety!

AD_PaperBoys_5.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy

AD_PaperBoys_13.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_13.text: Pick up your Gazette today to find out how to stay safe.

AD_PaperBoys_12.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_12.text: Breaking news - Lord Gortash is dead! The Mouth said it first.

AD_PaperBoys_3.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_3.text: Darling duke discovered dead! City in disarray!

AD_PaperBoys_14.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_14.text: Foul play afoot or tragic accident? The Baldur's Mouth investigates.

AD_PaperBoys_18.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_18.text: Keep up to date on the lord that's late - pick up your Gazette today!
AD_PaperBoys_18.context: InternalNodeContext: late as in deadNodeContext: late as in dead

AD_PaperBoys_16.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_16.text: Stories! Stories! Get them right here!

AD_PaperBoys_15.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_15.text: The printing block has never been so hot!

AD_PaperBoys_0.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_0.text: Scandals! Vandals! Where to buy sandals! It's all here in the Baldur's Mouth Gazette!

AD_PaperBoys_6.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_6.text: Danger! Danger! 'Evil Adventurers Put City in Danger'! What will the Flaming Fist do about it?

AD_PaperBoys_22.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_22.text: Today's good news: 'Heroic Adventurers Arrive to Save City From Absolute'!

AD_PaperBoys_1.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_1.text: In today's edition: Circus of the Last Days is struck by tragedy! Dribbles the Clown has been killed! Buy the Mouth for the inside track!

AD_PaperBoys_23.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_23.text: A Gazette a day keeps the ignorance away!

AD_PaperBoys_10.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_10.text: Today: 'Murder at Lathander's Feet! Head Priest Killed!' Investigator Valeria is on the case!

AD_PaperBoys_24.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_24.text: In today's papers - 'Steel Watchers Save City from Deep Gnome Assault'!

AD_PaperBoys_9.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_9.text: Are you invited to Gortash's ceremony? If not, worry not - read all about the coronation of Baldur's Gate's first Archduke in today's issue!

AD_PaperBoys_4.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_4.text: 'Foul Hag Finally Destroyed - Victims Freed Too'! Read up on all the gory details before we sell out!

AD_PaperBoys_17.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_17.text: Today's issue is smoking hot! Just like Ramazith's Tower! Find out why inside!

AD_PaperBoys_20.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_20.text: Curious news: 'Strange Disturbance Spotted in Grey Harbour'! Speculations galore!

AD_PaperBoys_8.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_8.text: Today's copy lands with a BANG! The Steel Watch Foundry has been destroyed by sabotage!

AD_PaperBoys_21.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_21.text: Breaking news! Hear all about it! The Mouth said it first!

AD_PaperBoys_25.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_25.text: New heroes grace Baldur's Gate with their presence!

AD_PaperBoys_2.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_2.text: They've saved others and they'll save us too!

AD_PaperBoys_19.speaker: News Hawker Chalara, News Hawker Jason, News Hawker Jonah, News Hawker Luan, Silfy
AD_PaperBoys_19.text: Pick up a copy and read all about it!

Wanderer_05_0.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_0.text: Unbelievable... Look. Lord Gortash died, I get it - tragic, whatever. I understand the Mouth needs some space to cover it.

Wanderer_05_7.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_7.text: But to cut the puzzle section? The best bit of any broadsheet? Madness, I tell you.

Wanderer_05_2.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_2.text: Can you believe it? They removed the Baldur's Mouth puzzle section. That was the best bit.

Wanderer_05_10.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_10.text: And for what? An interview with some lord? I don't care what he's done - I just want my lettergames back.

Wanderer_05_3.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_3.text: If they don't put the puzzles back in the broadsheet, I'm writing a strongly worded letter to that editor, believe you me.
Wanderer_05_3.context: NodeContext: immediately ranting to you about their pet peeve

Wanderer_05_5.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_5.text: Wait, of course you can believe it. They cut it because of your bloody puff piece. Arsehole.

Wanderer_05_6.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_6.text: Look, all I'm asking is you clean up your act. If they stop writing about you, they'll have space for puzzles again.

Wanderer_05_8.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_8.text: Don't care how many lords drop dead - if they touch my puzzle section again, I'll be writing in to the Baldur's Mouth editor.
Wanderer_05_8.context: NodeContext: immediately ranting to you about their pet peeve

Wanderer_05_9.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_9.text: I don't care how brilliant you are - cut it out. If they keep writing about you, there'll never be space for my puzzles.

Wanderer_05_1.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
Wanderer_05_1.text: Hang on - you're the reason they cut it! That bloody great article about your shady nonsense. Arsehole.

AD_PickedUpPositiveArticle_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_PickedUpPositiveArticle_1.text: *The block has a broadsheet article engraved upon it. It speaks positively of you.*

Guard3_DefaultDialog_0.speaker: Guard Hertvor Dremble
Guard3_DefaultDialog_0.text: You ever heard of this many guards for a bloody broadsheet? It's ridiculous.

Guard3_DefaultDialog_1.speaker: Guard Hertvor Dremble
Guard3_DefaultDialog_1.text: Bloody writers. If the pen really were mightier than the sword, they wouldn't need us.

MalekStones_1.speaker: Malek Stones
MalekStones_1.text: Gortash knew what was going on, and they got him. I'll prove it yet.

MalekStones_0.speaker: Malek Stones
MalekStones_0.text: Now I just need to figure out who 'they' are...

MalekStones_2.speaker: Malek Stones
MalekStones_2.text: Damn it damn it DAMN IT! Still missing one link... Oi, shove off! Don't you be peeking at my scoop!

MalekStones_3.speaker: Malek Stones
MalekStones_3.text: The truth cannot be interrupted, stop wasting my time!

MalekStones_4.speaker: Malek Stones
MalekStones_4.text: Hey, look, I saw nothing. Far as I'm concerned, Ettvard just dropped dead. No foul play here. Pleasepleaseplease don't hurt me.

MalekStones_5.speaker: Malek Stones
MalekStones_5.text: Too busy to chat, civilian. I've a paper to run - the truth will finally be spread!

Wanderer_04_0.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_0.text: Why yes, I'd love to do an interview!

Wanderer_04_7.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_7.text: Oh, sorry. Thought you were one of the Mouth's journalists.

Wanderer_04_1.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_1.text: I saw you in the Baldur's Mouth! Gods, how thrilling.

Wanderer_04_2.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_2.text: I'd love a proper interview - my name in the broadsheet, a chance to meet Mr Needle...

Wanderer_04_3.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_3.text: It's really not fair. Folks like you can act abhorrently and get in the gazette.

Wanderer_04_5.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_5.text: But us good, normal folk? We don't get any attention at all.

Wanderer_04_4.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_4.text: Oh yes, it's a tragedy what happened to Lord Gortash, to be sure. But on the other hand...

Wanderer_04_8.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_8.text: Maybe the Mouth will finally interview some regular people once in a while! Gortash was taking up a lot of column space.

Wanderer_04_6.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_6.text: Don't stand too close. If I'm seen with you, no one will speak to me, let alone interview me.

Wanderer_04_9.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_9.text: Be lovely to get an interview - maybe they'll be asking regular city-folk about Gortash's death... Hmmm.

Wanderer_04_10.speaker: Sadar Illanov
Wanderer_04_10.text: If you've got connections at Baldur's Mouth - put in a word, will you? This city deserves to hear what I got to say.

FrontDoorGuard_002_0.speaker: Guard Baalfe
FrontDoorGuard_002_0.text: This ain't the worst posting, I suppose. Beats guarding the docks, place reeks.

FrontDoorGuard_002_1.speaker: Guard Baalfe
FrontDoorGuard_002_1.text: Dunno what you said in there, pal, but you're not to go back in.

FrontDoorGuard_002_2.speaker: Guard Baalfe
FrontDoorGuard_002_2.text: Watch yourself in there - sarky bastards, these writer types.

Estra_DefaultDialog_5.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_5.text: No, dear reader, I'm afraid one of my columns is not in the latest issue. 'Print issues limiting space', according to our esteemed editor.
Estra_DefaultDialog_5.context: NodeContext: said with pure, unadulterated disdain towards the editor who's cut her column

Estra_DefaultDialog_12.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_12.text: Oh, you again. If you want a broadsheet, I'd advise acquiring one sharpish. We're running low. Printer issues, says Ettvard.
Estra_DefaultDialog_12.context: NodeContext: said with pure, unadulterated disdain towards the editor who's cut her column

Estra_DefaultDialog_13.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_13.text: I'm afraid your piece hasn't gone to print yet, my sweet. Patience.

Estra_DefaultDialog_14.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_14.text: Oh ho. You. I know you. How delightful to meet in person, though you're shorter than I expected.

Estra_DefaultDialog_56.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_56.text: You have me at a disadvantage, I've no idea who you are.

Estra_DefaultDialog_23.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_23.text: Sorry, how do you know me?

Estra_DefaultDialog_41.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_41.text: 'How' is such an overrated question. It's the who and the why that matter, darling.

Estra_DefaultDialog_16.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_16.text: You must have mistaken me for someone. I'm Bhaal's favourite child.

Estra_DefaultDialog_43.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_43.text: With grandiose delusions like that, you'll fit perfectly in the news business. Pleasure to meet you - and as for me...

Estra_DefaultDialog_30.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_30.text: It's just an opinion. It's my job to have them - I meant no offence.

Estra_DefaultDialog_26.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_26.text: My name's Estra Stir. Journalist. I speak to the people of Baldur's Gate so our readers don't have to.

Estra_DefaultDialog_61.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_61.text: How did you know who I was?

Estra_DefaultDialog_9.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_9.text: I work for the greatest broadsheet in this storied city. It's my job to know who is who. I imagine you'll be becoming quite familiar with it soon.

Estra_DefaultDialog_39.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_39.text: What broadsheet do you work for, Estra?

Estra_DefaultDialog_1.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_1.text: Why, the Baldur's Mouth Gazette, of course! I would certainly recommend picking up a copy in the near future.

Estra_DefaultDialog_22.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_22.text: You are, after all, the star of the next Baldur's Mouth Gazette.

Estra_DefaultDialog_0.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_0.text: I've never been in a broadsheet before - where can I buy a copy?

Estra_DefaultDialog_53.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_53.text: It's not out yet, but any of the Gazetteers can sell you a copy when it's printed.

Estra_DefaultDialog_24.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_24.text: And what's the headline of that edition...?

Estra_DefaultDialog_34.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_34.text: If I told you, you'd lose the fun of reading it yourself.

Estra_DefaultDialog_20.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_20.text: I never asked to be written about.

Estra_DefaultDialog_2.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_2.text: No one ever does, my sweet. But look on the bright side, you'll be famous.

Estra_DefaultDialog_32.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_32.text: It's our juiciest edition in an age - bound to get everyone talking about you.

Estra_DefaultDialog_33.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_33.text: I look forward to reading it.

Estra_DefaultDialog_21.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_21.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I've really said rather to much and written rather too little. Good day.

Estra_DefaultDialog_52.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_52.text: Don't I get a say in this?

Estra_DefaultDialog_50.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_50.text: Darling, we can't let the readers decide what the content is. We've editors for that.

Estra_DefaultDialog_4.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_4.text: Well, it's about damn time! Which of my many deeds did you chronicle?

Estra_DefaultDialog_10.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_10.text: Are your readers not also people of Baldur's Gate?

Estra_DefaultDialog_28.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_28.text: Well, there's people, and then there's people. You, my dear, are people.

Estra_DefaultDialog_55.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_55.text: In fact, you're the star of the next edition.

Estra_DefaultDialog_36.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_36.text: You work for the Baldur's Mouth Gazette, I presume.

Estra_DefaultDialog_31.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_31.text: You are quite correct - the best broadsheet around. I would certainly recommend picking up a copy in the near future.

Estra_DefaultDialog_59.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_59.text: Nice to meet you - I really must get going.

Estra_DefaultDialog_27.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_27.text: Toodle-oo! I look forward to seeing you grace our front pages.

Estra_DefaultDialog_18.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_18.text: Look, sorry, I'm looking for new interview subjects - we need some fresh takes on the demise of the dearly departed Duke Gortash.

Estra_DefaultDialog_35.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_35.text: It's a real shame your illustrious stint on the broadsheet covers was upstaged - Lord Gortash's death would do that though, I suppose.

Estra_DefaultDialog_38.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_38.text: You're already set to feature in the Baldur's Mouth Gazette, dear. Let me find some other subjects.

Estra_DefaultDialog_44.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_44.text: I can tell an inquisitive sort when I see one - want the real story behind the untimely demise of Lord Enver Gortash?

Estra_DefaultDialog_8.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_8.text: Well, then there's a high chance that your testimony has already found its way into the latest edition!

Estra_DefaultDialog_19.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_19.text: Go on then - what really happened?

Estra_DefaultDialog_15.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_15.text: Well, if I just told you, you'd have no reason to read our latest edition!

Estra_DefaultDialog_57.speaker: Player
Estra_DefaultDialog_57.text: I'd rather never hear that prick's name again, thanks.

Estra_DefaultDialog_6.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_6.text: Oh, come now - everyone loves a good obituary. And the one in our latest edition is to die for.

Estra_DefaultDialog_47.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_47.text: Pick up the Baldur's Mouth - our city's broadsheet of record - to find out more. Dear reader, you will be most satisfied.

Estra_DefaultDialog_45.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_45.text: Your write-up in the latest Gazette might seem harsh, but think about it - so few people ever experience true infamy. It's a privilege, in a way.

Estra_DefaultDialog_49.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_49.text: Well well - the very unlikely hero of our latest gazette. Don't let the fame go to your head, now.

Estra_DefaultDialog_51.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_51.text: Seems your stint in the harsh light of infamy was to be short-lived, my sweet. Not as short lived as Lord Gortash, mind you.

Estra_DefaultDialog_54.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_54.text: Can you believe the injustice? Our beloved editor falls in the line of duty, and they don't give me his job? Disgusting.

Estra_DefaultDialog_60.speaker: Estra Stir
Estra_DefaultDialog_60.text: I read your write-up in the latest edition - my condolences. Ettvard really went for the unmentionables.

Cynics_000_0.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_0.text: Quit starin' at me. I'll talk about what I want - dead Gortash or no.

Cynics_000_1.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_1.text: Oh, if it isn't the conquering heroes I read about in the Gazette! I'm not buying it, pal. Sling your hook.

Cynics_000_2.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_2.text: Oi - you again. Staring again. If I end up in that rag of a broadsheet, I know who to blame.

Cynics_000_3.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_3.text: Heh. I read about you in the paper. Seems someone's been a bit naughty.

Cynics_000_4.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_4.text: What you staring at, pal? You dropping eaves? Get gone.

Cynics_000_5.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_5.text: The gazette can blow all the smoke up you that it likes - don't mean I have to care.

Cynics_000_6.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_6.text: Keep starin' and you'll end up in the obituaries with Gortash. Get on your way.

Cynics_000_7.speaker: Sharlz Molar
Cynics_000_7.text: Look, whatever you're doing, it's obviously pissing off those hacks at the gazette. So crack on.

Guard_DefaultDialog_0.speaker: Narrator
Guard_DefaultDialog_0.text: *Since you already convinced the guard to let you in, better leave her alone lest she changes her mind.*

Guard_DefaultDialog_1.speaker: Guard Unilda Tiro
Guard_DefaultDialog_1.text: Hang on, you're not allowed down in the basement. Only Master Needle is permitted access to the printworks.

Guard_DefaultDialog_2.speaker: Guard Unilda Tiro
Guard_DefaultDialog_2.text: I told you already, no access to the printer room. If you keep forgetting, I'll print it out and nail it to yer head. Sod off.

Wanderer_08_0.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_0.text: The Mouth can publish all the fluff pieces it wants about those Steel Watchers. I think they're a menace.

Wanderer_08_1.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_1.text: Saw you in the broadsheet - makes a change from them fawning over Lord Gortash.

Wanderer_08_2.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_2.text: If the Steel Watch couldn't protect Lord Gortash from assassins, what good are they?

Wanderer_08_4.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_4.text: Newspaper says Steel Watch production is increasing. Doesn't seem to help Lord Gortash keep ruffians like you off the streets.

Wanderer_08_5.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_5.text: Takes a lot to push Lord Gortash from the front pages.

Wanderer_08_3.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_3.text: But I'm not surprised, considering how absolutely rotten you've been. Get away from me.

Wanderer_08_6.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_6.text: I'd rather not be seen talking to you - your misdeeds are the talk of the city.

Wanderer_08_7.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_7.text: Keep up the good work and Baldur's Mouth will keep licking your boots.

Wanderer_08_8.speaker: Wynn Freshwater
Wanderer_08_8.text: Never trusted the Steel Watch, and with Gortash dead, who's controlling them?

PaperBoy_Stormshore_0.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_0.text: I d-don't want to get h-hurt! Leave me alone!

PaperBoy_Stormshore_5.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_5.text: Sorry for pulling the wool over your eyes. Want another paper? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperBoy_Stormshore_14.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_14.text: Um... Er... He - hello? Does - does anyone want to b-buy a gazette? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
PaperBoy_Stormshore_14.context: NodeContext: small voice, unsure, trying his best (this is actually a scam where he pretends to be sad so people buy papers)

PaperBoy_Stormshore_38.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_Stormshore_38.text: That's terrible salesmanship. Get your act together.

PaperBoy_Stormshore_13.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_13.text: B-b-but I don't know how! I'm only s-s-six!
PaperBoy_Stormshore_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: cryingNodeContext: he starts crying (he's actually only pretending to be sad so the player will buy a paper)

PaperBoy_Stormshore_35.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_35.text: DEAL! HA! Tricked you. Enjoy the read, sucker.
PaperBoy_Stormshore_35.context: NodeContext: complete tone change, was actually only pretending to be sad to the player would buy a paper. Delighted, jubilant

PaperBoy_Stormshore_26.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_Stormshore_26.text: I don't care, stand up straight! Project your voice!

PaperBoy_Stormshore_10.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_10.context: NodeContext: balling his eyes out (he's pretending)

PaperBoy_Stormshore_22.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_22.text: S'okay... everybody is mean to me anyway.

PaperBoy_Stormshore_17.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_Stormshore_17.text: I'm afraid I can't afford it.

PaperBoy_Stormshore_37.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_Stormshore_37.text: I'd love to, but I'm a bit busy. Maybe later.

PaperBoy_Stormshore_30.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_30.text: You're in the broadsheet. Want a copy? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperBoy_Stormshore_34.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_34.text: The move along, I've got papers to sell!

PaperBoy_Stormshore_33.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_33.text: Oh n-n-no! It's you... The one who did all them terrible th-things in the paper...

PaperBoy_Stormshore_2.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_Stormshore_2.text: Let me buy a copy. I want to see. (Give [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperBoy_Stormshore_7.speaker: Player
PaperBoy_Stormshore_7.text: If all that is true, you should be scared of me. Hand over the paper. NOW.

PaperBoy_Stormshore_24.speaker: News Hawker Luan
PaperBoy_Stormshore_24.text: I can't... Mister Ettvard will get all shouty with me...

PAD_HiddenSwitchUsed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HiddenSwitchUsed_0.text: Huh. Seemed to make something click into place up above.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_0.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_0.text: Those folk in the Baldur's Mouth headlines recently... Horrible.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_4.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_4.text: While they're hogging broadsheet pages, the puzzle section shrivels and dies.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_1.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_1.text: I mean, don't we have enough Heroes of Baldur's Gate already?

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_15.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_15.text: It's all just fluff pieces in the Mouth these days. Give me a break.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_5.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_5.text: Gortash this, Gortash that - nothing but the dead duke in the Gazette right now.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_2.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_2.text: The real tragedy here is the Baldur's Mouth cutting its puzzle section.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_6.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_6.text: Some lunatics enter the city and suddenly it's all the broadsheet will print.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_8.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_8.text: Interviews, politics, gossip - all of it gets in that bloody Baldur's Mouth rag.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_7.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_7.text: Except what the people actually want in a broadsheet - puzzles.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_10.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_10.text: Can't believe all this pandering nonsense the Mouth is printing.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_3.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_3.text: I don't care which necromancer they've killed - it's taking up too many pages.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_12.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_12.text: Forget adventurers - you know what'd be really heroic?

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_14.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_14.text: Someone bringing back the bloody puzzle section.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_13.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_13.text: I'm apoplectic. Furious. Frankly, I'm puzzled.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_16.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_16.text: That bloody Gazette - nothing but death, death, death.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_11.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_11.text: What the people want in a broadsheet is something fun. Puzzles, for instance.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_17.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_17.text: Can't bloody believe it. No more puzzles. A travesty.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_19.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_19.text: I know the Mouth thinks this Absolutist Adventurer beat is gold.

AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_18.speaker: Pritt Yellowbreath
AD_Wanderer_05_Greeting_18.text: But that's no reason to gut the rest of the broadsheet.

AutomatedPrinterDialog_25.speaker: Printing Press
AutomatedPrinterDialog_25.text: It was surely fun while it lasted - but looks like the late Lord Gortash has nabbed your headline spot.
